Entries.Biography:
Sig (never Sigurd) Bear is a recently discharged soldier who saw a fair bit of everything in Gotoro and is just getting back into the civilian life. He is 28 years old, stands 6'5", and cuts an imposing figure. He is grumpy and a bit down on his luck, but with the help of his family starts to see the good in things again even despite starting his life over. He can absolutely carry that for you, whatever. He is often found reading poetry, smoking, and trying to keep bees.

Sig is part of the Bear family, living with his aunt Sondra and siblings Gunnar and Gudrun. Despite his tough exterior, he is not mean-spirited and is slowly learning to find peace.

Sondra.Heading: Sondra
Sondra.Description: Sig's aunt. She moved to the valley with the family and provides a stable presence.

Gunnar.Heading: Gunnar
Gunnar.Description: Sig's brother. They share the family lodge.

Gudrun.Heading: Gudrun
Gudrun.Description: Sig's 14-year-old sister, a high school eco-activist who thinks he and Gunnar are dorks. She is part of Sig's support system in East Scarp.

Teren.Heading: Teren
Teren.Description: A close friend of Sig's in East Scarp.

Surly.Heading: Surly
Surly.Description: Grumpy, cynical, and often rude upon first meeting.

Strong.Heading: Strong
Strong.Description: At 6'5" and a former soldier, Sig is physically powerful.

Poetic.Heading: Poetic
Poetic.Description: Enjoys reading poetry, which serves as a quiet escape.

Weary.Heading: Weary
Weary.Description: Adjusting to civilian life after his time in Gotoro, which has left him tired.

Beekeeper.Heading: Beekeeper
Beekeeper.Description: Spends time trying to keep bees in East Scarp.

Entries.BiographyEnd: He is a marriageable candidate and lives at Bear Lodge.

Dialogue.Winter1: Winter's a good time to change things up. Maybe get another tattoo. Something tasteful or something tacky, that's the hard question.
Dialogue.GeneralQuote: Do you think it's weird Pierre has a place of worship tucked into his shop but keeps the shop open on Sundays? Blasphemous, almost.
